reasoning: Acute reactions to stress encompass acute stress disorder and acute adjustment reactions following traumatic or stressful life events. Incidence estimated at 35 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological surveys of stress-related psychiatric morbidity. This is broader than PTSD and includes subthreshold presentations.
source: Kessler RC et al. (2005). Lifetime prevalence and age-of-onset distributions of DSM-IV disorders. Archives of General Psychiatry. 62(6):593-602
